alert.note: Alert for Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 23 at 5:59AM AKST until February 25 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW BEGINNING THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY... .A strengthening low will move into the NE gulf Thursday evening with an associated front moving over the panhandle Friday morning. Dry snow will begin in the Yakutat area, then spreading from north to south across the panhandle. Some uncertainty exists regarding snow totals due to limited moisture available, particularly for the northern inner channels around Haines and Skagway. For most areas the greatest snowfall rates will be Friday evening. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON AKST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches possible. * WHERE...Northern Panhandle including: Skagway, Haines, Gustavus, Pelican, Hoonah, Juneau, and surrounding areas. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to noon AKST Friday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to reduced visibility and blowing snow. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light, dry, snow will fall Thursday night then greater rates are expected Friday afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
